intro: Zosterophyllanthos scabrilinguis, commonly known as the rough-leaved zosterophyllum, is a rare and specialized plant belonging to the order Zosterophyllales. It is characterized by its unique morphology, featuring elongated, ribbon-like leaves that are often covered in a rough, textured surface. This plant thrives in specific coastal environments, where it is adapted to withstand high salinity and periodic tidal inundation. Its reproductive structures are simple, consisting of small, spore-producing organs located at the base of the leaves. Due to its limited distribution and ecological specificity, Zosterophyllanthos scabrilinguis is considered a valuable subject for botanical research on marine plant adaptation.
